|| $17,215,275 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/2001W43/?ref_=bo_wey_table_14 |- | 44 || || rowspan="2" | Monsters, Inc. || $62,577,067 || Monsters, Inc. broke Toy Story 2s records ($57.4 mil) for the highest weekend debut in November, for an animated film, a G-rated film, and for the holiday season. It also broke How the Grinch Stole Christmas record ($55 mil) for the highest weekend debut for a non-sequel, The Lion Kings record ($40.8 mil) for the highest weekend debut for a non-sequel animated film, and Independence Days record ($50.2 mil) for the highest weekend debut for an original film overall. || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/2001W44/?ref_=bo_wey_table_13 |- | 45 || || $45,551,028 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/2001W45/?ref_=bo_wey_table_12 |- | 46 || || rowspan="3" | Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone || $90,294,621 || Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stones $32.3 million opening day gross broke Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menaces record ($28.5 mil) for the highest single-day tally of all time. It also broke The Lost World: Jurassic Parks record ($72.1 mil) for the highest weekend debut of all time, Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menaces record ($64.8 mil) for the highest weekend debut for a PG-rated film, Monsters, Incs records ($62.5 mil) for the highest weekend debut in November and for the holiday season as well as for a non- sequel (which had been set 2 weeks earlier) and Batman Forevers record ($52.7 mil) for the highest opening for a Warner Bros. film. Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone had the highest weekend debut of 2001. || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/2001W46/?ref_=bo_wey_table_11 |- | 47 || || $57,487,755 || Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone broke How the Grinch Stole Christmas record ($52.1 mil) for the highest second weekend gross, and Toy Story 2s record ($57.39 mil) for the highest Thanksgiving weekend ever. || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/2001W47/?ref_=bo_wey_table_8 |- | 48 || || $23,642,327 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/2001W48/?ref_=bo_wey_table_7 |- | 49 || || Ocean's Eleven || $38,107,822 || Ocean's Eleven broke What Women Wants record ($33.6 million) for the highest weekend debut in December, and Titanics second weekend grosses record ($35.4 mil) for the highest weekend ever in December. || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/2001W49/?ref_=bo_wey_table_6 |- | 50 || || Vanilla Sky || $25,015,518 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/2001W50/?ref_=bo_wey_table_5 |- | 51 || || rowspan="2" | The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring || $47,211,490 || The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring broke Ocean's Elevens record ($38.1 mil) for the highest weekend debut in December (which had been set 2 weeks earlier). || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/2001W51/?ref_=bo_wey_table_4 |- | 52 || || $38,695,582 || || https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/2001W52/?ref_=bo_wey_table_2 |} ==Highest-grossing films== ===Calendar Gross=== Highest-grossing films of 2001 by Calendar Gross {| class="wikitable" !
